description: From pedo- +‎ -phile, after Ancient Greek παιδοφῐ́λης (paidophílēs) (from παῖς (paîs, “boy, child”) +‎ φιλέω (philéō, “I love”)).

entries.meaning: (psychiatry, sexology) A person aged 16 years old or older who is mostly or only sexually attracted toward prepubescent children. [from 20th c.]
examples: Apart from his sexual behavior, the pedophile is typically law abiding.

entries.meaning: (by extension, common use) An adult who is sexually attracted to or engages in sexual acts with a child.
